channel.title: Combine Code Words
channel.description:
I love the convoluted codes that the Combine use. After listening closely to Overwatch and Combine Soldier dialogue, as well as examining "sentences.txt", I've been able to generate a list of the probable definitions of most of the Combine code words for things:
[b]Code : Definition / Rebel Term[/b]
Anticitizen 1 : Gordon Freeman Airwatch : Scanner Network / Air Units Biotic : Antlion (Could possibly also refer to other Xen creatures.) Bodypack : Armour Boomer : Gunship (?) Bouncer : Enemy Grenade (Zombines use this for their own grenades.) Cauterize : Cut Off Containment Field : Shield Control Section : Citadel Dislocate : Remove Displace : Retreat Deserviced / Duty Vacated : Dead (Used for friendlies) Exogen : (Usually used to refer to Antlions, but also occasionally to other hazards such as reprogrammed Sentry Turrets and Rollermines.) Expunge : Kill Extractor : Friendly Grenade Flare : Grenade (In general) Ghost 2 : Gordon Freeman Interpose : Cover Lock : Stand Ground Hard-Point : Mounted Gun Emplacement / Bunker Hurricane : Key Resistance Figure (Not Gordon. Used to define status of "outbreak") Necrotic : Zombie Noncitizen : Rebel Outbreak : Human Revolt (When said three times in short succession, means that the speaker is overwhelmed.) Parasite / Parasitic: Headcrab Phantom : Gordon Freeman Political Conscript : Stalker (?) Priority 1 Objective / Primary Target : Gordon Freeman Probe : Investigate Prosecute : Assault Restrictor : Thumper Ripcord : Retreat Signature Imprint : Data Packet (Presumably) Sterilizer : Sentry Turret Storm System : Canal Tag : Kill Target 1 : Gordon Freeman Transport : Teleporter Universal Union : Combine Vance Prime : Eli Vance (Presumably) Vance Sub-Prime : Alyx Vance Viscon : Enemy Sighted Verdict : Bullet Virome : Antlion Viscerator : Manhack Workforce Intake Hub : Trainstation 10-99 : Overrun 10-108 : Friendly Dead / Death 404 : Riot
I may have missed a few, and of course some are speculation, but I've tried to determine the best definitions when taking into account where they are used, etc. Your thoughts?

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
That suffers from the same problem. He was working for the resistance too.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Ramsey
item.description:
Nintyuk:

Cool idea, but I’ve never attributed subtlety to the combine.
The closest thing to a combine spy was Judith Mossman who turned out to be a double agent.

Remember Barney, from the beginning of Half-Life 2? He was undercover as a Metrocop.

Read full topic

item.description:
A lot of them don’t have captions, though.

item.description:
I suggest toggling ON closed captions if you want to be able to read all of the PA messages.

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: gatorboy2009
item.description:
If you use the cvar that allows snipers to speak, the word they call out when they kill something is “blockdown”.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Political conscript refers to Stalkers due to the context. “Attention Nova Prospekt internal containment teams. De-service all political conscripts in block A7. Prohibit external contact.” (fprison_deservicepoliticalconscripts.wav)

Conscripts might also refer to metrocops, but I can’t tell from the file alone. (citizensummoned.wav) “Reporting citizen summoned to voluntary conscription for general public service detail T94-322” With that combine newspeak, it could mean that they voluntary rebelled, and thus agreed to becoming stalkers. Or something along those lines.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Right4Dead
item.description:
I think political conscript is supposed to mean wallace breen.
Although I think in the HL2 beta conscripts were something like metrocops.
Anyways, nice list.

Read full topic

hey guys,
in the combine phonetic alphabet:
G=ghost F=phantom
GF…it either means gordon freeman or girl friend

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Floyd
item.description:
^ Possibly. I’d love it if they were referring to beta creatures. To me, it doesn’t make sense that the enemies shown to the player in HL2 are the only ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
Sabre-toothed Lime:

About the Airwatch, you said it gives reports on what it sees?
Well, if the voice is from a standard Soldier, then it must apply to either a Dropship or a Hunter Chopper.
Gunships dont seem to do much talking. But they sure are awesome. They remind me of the Halo Hunters, always lookin out for the other one of the pair.

They may not do actual talking, but it’s possible that they could automatically transmit any malignant sightings to the Airwatch network.

Floyd:

I’m curious as to what ‘winder’ and ‘skyshield’ are when requested by the Combine soldiers. See ‘overwatchrequest’ audio.

I’m pretty sure they might be referring to reinforcement or possibly dropships - “skyshield” in particular.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Floyd
item.description:
Nice one, would be good to see it if you complete it. I did that for the Overwatch city voice, if only to satisfy curiosity. Which ones do you need help with?

I’m curious as to what ‘winder’ and ‘skyshield’ are when requested by the Combine soldiers. See ‘overwatchrequest’ audio.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
I’ve been trying to transcribe the combine speech sound files, so they’d be easier to understand, but the files with the prison_soldier_ prefix are to fast, long. I was actually bored enough yesterday to do all of them with only a few real complete blanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
I always thought that these were either the Overwatch phonetic alphabet or if they were procedural instructions issued to Combine forces.

In any case if I can nitpick…

Of course! That’s what this thread is really for, to discuss different interpretations of what they say.

Anticitizen 1 isn’t specific to Gordon Freeman, it’s a level of citizen status, kind of like saying “the most wanted” though surely Gordon is the only person to have ever attained it.

Since he’s who they’re referring to when they say it, it makes sense to define it as him, but you’re right, there is more to it than that.

Airwatch I believe refers to Combine Gunships and Helicopters rather than scanners… Scanners are apparently automated, so I don’t think they would take instruction through announcements.

I don’t know, I haven’t heard any announcements that are directly giving orders to the Airwatch. The only references I’ve found to the Airwatch is giving ground units updates as to what it has found or is doing.

Biotics (in Episode 2 refer specifically to Gordon and Alyx) seems to refer to human/earth lifeforms.

Possibly, but it is said in an area that contains an Antlion hive. This leads me to think that it is referring to them, rather that Alyx or Gordon, especially as you hear a soldier on the radio in Nova Prospekt talking about how “Primary Target is engaged in command and control tactics with Biotics”.

Containment Field means the Combine forcefields that do not permit non-combine organisms to pass through.

That’s pretty much what I meant by “shield”. Although it could also refer to the ones that let authorized citizens pass through, that you see in the beginning.

Control Section sounds more as if it refers to a district/designated sector of City 17.

It’s definitely the Citadel, or at least a description of it. “sentences.txt” gives a list of places, used for metropolice radio chatter (e.g. when they die), an extract of which:

// map 8 citadel
V_G1_LOCATION_MAP08P0 highpriorityregion
V_G1_LOCATION_MAP08P1 terminalrestrictionzone
V_G1_LOCATION_MAP08P2 controlsection[/SIZE]

Exogen specifically refers to Antlions.

You can sometimes hear soldiers say “Visual on exogens.” when they see reprogrammed sentry turrets. Of course, this may be an error on the developer’s part.

Anyway… bouncer and boomer don’t sound like Combine dialogue… but perhaps refer to hopper mines and thumpers? I sincerely doubt boomer refers to gunships.

Bouncer definitely means grenades, but Boomer is a bit more speculative. Thumpers are definitely called Restrictors, so I doubt it could be them. My definition is derived from a soldier radio transmission (filename “prison_soldier_boomersinbound.wav”) that you hear in the final bunker before climbing up to Nova Prospekt, which says something that sounds very like “Overwatch confirms double boomers dispatched, inbound. Coast drop inbound. Prepare for special heavy suppression and wrap 'em.”

Since you meet a pair of Gunships very shortly after that, this leads me to believe that the “boomers” that the soldier was talking about were Gunships. And they do make sort of boomey noises.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
Thanks dude, i will use this on my mod when i know how to mod.XD(No, but really)

And i think every combine is it own code like “C17-3-4” C17 is mean from City 17, from team 3 combine soldier 4, This just my own theory, don’t get too drag away by these.

I hear combine soldier say "Outbreak"x3 when i spawn 4-6 combine soldier in ravenholm for fun, i laugh out when i saw the last combine soldier say “Outbreak!Outbreak!Outbreak!” before mow down by zombies.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Super_Toast
item.description:
Mangled*:

Anyway… bouncer and boomer don’t sound like Combine dialogue… but perhaps refer to hopper mines and thumpers? I sincerely doubt boomer refers to gunships.

I don’t know about boomer myself, but I was replaying HL2 yesterday, and I heard a Combine soldier clearly yell “Bouncer!” as he was running from a grenade I tossed at him, so Bouncer does indeed seem to at least refer to enemy grenades.

I haven’t heard Boomer used ingame (Though I might have just not understood the soldier or just wasn’t paying attention), but it would make sense if it referred to hopper mines or thumpers.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Nintyuk
item.description:
Master Chef:

I never thought of CP’s having families before.

Off Topic: Wouldn’t be kinda cool if you fought undercover CP’s that impersonated rebels/citizens?

Cool idea, but I’ve never attributed subtlety to the combine.
The closest thing to a combine spy was Judith Mossman who turned out to be a double agent.

I’ve never under stood much of the combine radio chatter, Normally i’m more worried about my health bar or theirs. But I’ve always been interested in what I consider is missed dialogue.

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
“Attention. Rank leaders. Reminder: one hundred sterilized credits qualifies non-mechanical reproduction simulation.”

Other notable comments by the Overwatch Dispatcher are “Premature mission termination will result in fifty percent reproduction credits.” and “Memory replacement is the first step towards rank privileges.”

Moreover, when a metrocop kills you, you sometimes hear her say “Reward Notice: Protection Team member, your family cohesion is preserved.” So as well as rewarding brutality with non-mechanical reproduction simulations, they also allow them to stay with their loved ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: NesKwik
item.description:
in Red Letter Day when you are being chased by the Metrocops you can hear the PA system say “Remember: Good work results in the privilige of non-mechanical reproduction simulation.”

So yes, they are bribing the officers with simu-sex if they kill gordon freeman.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Floyd
item.description:
Good find man. A lot of interesting information in there that I hadn’t checked or seen before. That’s not the complete phonetic alphabet that’s available though, as victor and x-ray of the existing NATO one are both missing. I’m most intrigued by the air support names.

// air support names:

V_RNDNAMES0 ghost {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES1 reaper {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES2 nomad {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES3 hurricane {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES4 phantom {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES5 judge {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES6 shadow {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES7 slam {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES8 stinger {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES9 storm {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES10 vamp {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES11 winder {Len 0.4}
V_RNDNAMES12 star {Len 0.4}

Ghost and phantom already refer to Freeman, so I’m wondering what the rest refer to? All air support units? So that would include scanners, synths scanners, manhacks, hunter choppers and gunships I would guess. I had no idea they put so much thought into the game. I had just assumed that the soldiers’ speech was meant to be unintelligible.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Code Words
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
Interesting: sentences.txt (located in source engine.gcf/scripts, in case anyone else wants to check it out) does give a partial phonetic alphabet list:

//phonetic alphabet/codes:
V_RNDCODES0 apex {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES1 ion {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES2 jet {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES3 kilo {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES4 mace {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES5 nova {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES6 payback {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES7 sundown {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES8 uniform {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES9 boomer {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES10 echo {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES11 flatline {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES12 helix {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES13 ice {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES14 quicksand {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES15 payback {Len 0.4}
V_RNDCODES16 ripcord {Len 0.4}

A lot of the other words you used refer to squad names for soldiers or Civil Protection officer. The more violent ones tend to be soldiers, whereas Civil Protection has names like “defender”, “hero” and “union”.

Read full topic
